bill_title: clarify the effect of student suspension or expulsion on transfers.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to clarify the effect of student suspension or expulsion on transfers. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 13-32-4.3 be amended to read as follows: 13-32-4.3. If any student is under suspension or expulsion in a school district from any school from any school, the student may not be transferred to another enrolled in a school district until the suspension or expulsion has expired. If the suspension or expulsion is from a school in another state or a nonpublic school in this state, the suspension or expulsion shall be based upon reasons which would result in suspension or expulsion from a school district in this state. The sending district school shall notify, in writing, the receiving district school of the suspension or expulsion upon receiving a request of for the student's permanent school records by from the receiving school. 500 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.021 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to clarify the effect of student suspension or expulsion on transfers. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 13-32-4.3 be amended to read as follows: 13-32-4.3. If any student is under suspension or expulsion in a school district from any school , the student may not be transferred to another enrolled in a school district until the suspension or expulsion has expired. If the suspension or expulsion is from a school in another state or a nonpublic school in this state, the suspension or expulsion shall be based upon reasons which would result in suspension or expulsion from a school district in this state. The sending district school shall notify, in writing, the receiving district school of the suspension or expulsion upon receiving a request of for the student's permanent school records by from the receiving school. BILL HISTORY 1/21/00 First read in House and referred to Education. H.J. 176 1/27/00 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 1/27/00 Education Do Pass Amended, Passed, AYES 13, NAYS 0. H.J. 265 1/27/00 Education Place on Consent Calendar.
